structure.unit: Nominations, Questions To Be Submitted To The Voters, Primaries And Caucuses

law.catch_line: Number Of Votes Necessary To Nominate Candidate Not On Ballot
law.text: No person who is a candidate at a primary for nomination for or election to a political office, if no candidateâ€™s name is printed on the ballot therefor, shall be deemed to be nominated or elected unless he receives a number of votes at least equal to the number of signatures which would be required by law to place his name on the ballot at such primary as a candidate as aforesaid.
